Save Easy Ways to save on restaurants and groceries Skip to content Home blog Pizza Restaurants Restaurants Groceries Retail Stores Contact Us Search for: ← Taco Bueno Coupons Texas Roadhouse Coupons → Taco Cabana coupons Posted on April 24, 2011 by admin Taco Cabana is a U.S.-based fast food restaurant chain specializing in Tex-Mex cuisine and is a full owned subsidiary of Carrols Corporation. Taco Cabana is headquartered in San Antonio, Texas. As of July 2007, it has more than 150 locations throughout Texas, Oklahoma and New Mexico. Numerous Taco Cabana restaurants are open 24 hours a day, and for most in the chain’s history all locations were painted inside the company’s signature pink.
Taco Cabana, which was founded by Mike and Felix Stehling in 1978, opened its very first restaurant at the corner of San Pedro and Hildebrand Avenues in San Antonio, Texas. Originally the brothers purchased the vacant Dairy Queen since they required parking space for their well-known bar, the Chrystal Pistol, across the street. Recognizing the potential organization opportunity, they decided to open a taco stand. The open air type in the existing structure led towards the“patio cafe”idea that defined the chain’s subsequent locations. Additionally, after all of the patio furniture was stolen after closing the very first night, the around-the-clock program idea began.
In January 1993 Taco Cabana announced that it was purchasing money strapped A couple of Pesos’restaurant assets in exchange for 940,000 shares of Taco Cabana stock, approximately valued at $22 million. The sale included all 38 company-owned restaurants as well as all 51 franchised or licensed restaurants, operating under the A couple of Pesos and Shortstop Hamburgers names. Taco Cabana converted most A couple of Pesos locations into Taco Cabana restaurants, closed others and sold the Shortstop Hamburger chain.

Taco Cabana coupons often feature an expiration date and make sure you use them on or before the date printed to receive the mentioned savings. Typically, they require a minimum acquire and may only be valid on specified menu items. Taco Cabana only allows a single one per purchase. Printable coupons for Taco Cabana is also observed inside a amount of locations, but essentially the most place for valid ones is via membership inside the restaurant’s free Cabana Club. Sign up is free on their site and requires an email address. Just for joining, you will often receive a coupon including a purchase one, get a single free offer. Beef Tacos With Fresh Salsa
1 small onion
3 tablespoons olive or other vegetable oil
2 cloves garlic, minced or crushed through a press
1/2 pound lean ground beef
Half a 14 1/2-ounce can stewed tomatoes, drained
Half a 4-ounce can of chopped mild green chilies, drained
2 tablespoons chili powder
1 1/2 teaspoons cumin
1 teaspoon oregano
Pinch of cayenne pepper
1 small green bell pepper
1 medium fresh tomato 3 scallions
1/4 cup cilantro sprigs (optional)
2 tablespoons red wine vinegar or cider vinegar
1/4 teaspoon black pepper
3 drops hot pepper sauce
2 cups shredded Romaine lettuce
12 taco shells
1 Coarsely chop the onion. 2 In a large skillet, warm 1 tablespoon of the oil over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Add the onion and garlic and cook until the mixture begins to brown, 3 to 5 minutes. 3 Crumble in the beef and cook, breaking up the beef with a spoon, for 2 to 3 minutes. 4 Add the stewed tomatoes, green chilies, chili powder, cumin, 1/4 teaspoon of the oregano and the cayenne, breaking up the tomatoes with a spoon. Reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer while you prepare the remaining ingredients. 5 Coarsely chop the bell pepper, fresh tomato and scallions. Finely chop the cilantro (if using). 6 In a small bowl, combine the bell pepper, tomato, scallions, cilantro, the remaining 2 tablespoons oil, the vinegar, the remaining 3/4 teaspoon oregano, the black pepper and hot pepper sauce. 7 Shred the lettuce. 8 Fill each taco shell with 1/4 cup of the beef mixture and top with shredded lettuce.
